title: Cs 577 Algos
body: Anyone have their notes I could take a look at? The class sounds scary
comments: make no mistake, it is an advanced math class.  if you come into it without a solid ability to write proofs, you're gonna have a hard time.  but even without that skill, as long as you max out your attendance points / extra credit / homeworks /do decently on the quizzes you can still pass and do well with the curve.  I think the average score on the final during my semester was 23/40.

[https://pages.cs.wisc.edu/\~hasti/cs240/readings/](https://pages.cs.wisc.edu/~hasti/cs240/readings/)

The above readings are a great refresher for the prerequisites for the course.

[https://edisciplinas.usp.br/pluginfile.php/7933913/course/section/6549987/Algorithm%20Design.pdf](https://edisciplinas.usp.br/pluginfile.php/7933913/course/section/6549987/Algorithm%20Design.pdf)

The above PDF is the main textbook for the course. 

Other than that, doing LeetCode problems is the way to go.
